categories.title: AI Agents, Workaholic Culture, and Digital Innovation

content.text: Shaw (@shawmakesmagic) discusses the distinction between tools and agents in AI, noting that 'Tools work alone, Agents work across.' He's actively developing AI agents, including a todo list agent app for Eliza and an open-source agent named Eddy.

Shaw reflects on workaholic culture, agreeing with the sentiment that 'Every great founder is a workaholic who followed their passion until it became their profession.' He admits to his own workaholic tendencies, saying 'I tried to take a day off and made a hyperfy plugin.'

Shaw shares thoughts on the metaverse and simulation theory, suggesting 'What if the metaverse was just a benchmark for agents' and pondering if we're living in a simulation. He's working on 3D multiplayer worlds and AI, questioning if our reality might become a simulation as 'computers keep evolving for another 50 years.'

Auto.fun announces the integration of DogLifeAI into their platform, describing it as an 'AI-powered healthspan companion' that helps monitor and extend dogs' health with personalized veterinary insights. They emphasize that 'agents are for everyone, especially dogs.'

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently. PR #4449 by monilpat introduces a new polygon feature to the system. Meanwhile, user K1mc4n has submitted multiple PRs (#4451, #4452, and #4453) to create a README_IND.md file, likely an Indonesian translation of the project's documentation. K1mc4n also submitted PR #4455 which focuses on improvements to the Indonesian documentation.

Several bug fixes and maintenance updates were recently made to the ElizaOS repository:

1. Fixed a broken image path in the Thai README (PR #4433)

2. Removed plugin-redpill from the monorepo (PR #4428)

3. Fixed issues with the plugin installation command and startup functionality (PR #4456)

4. Resolved version installation issues marked as a hot fix (PR #4454)

From May 5-6, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity with 9 new pull requests, of which 4 were merged. The repository also received 1 new issue during this period. A total of 9 contributors were actively working on the project during these two days.

categories.title: pglite log entry unicode escape error

content.text: Issue #4457 in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository reports a problem with pglite log entries having unicode escape errors. The issue was reported by user plvo.
